cs431:rssItem.title: Tupelo (Miss.) baseball on pace to finish unbeaten (USA Today)
cs431:rssItem.description: Tupelo is almost halfway to becoming the first Mississippi high school baseball team in 22 years to finish a season unbeaten. The Golden Wave are 19-0 and have beaten opponents by an average of almost eight runs.

cs431:rssItem.title: UM baseball team ranked No. 1 in nation (Miami Herald)
cs431:rssItem.description: The University of Miami baseball team is No. 1 in the nation. Of 296 Division I baseball teams across the country, the Hurricanes, with a 26-2 overall record and 12-1 record in the Atlantic Coast Conference, are the best according to Baseball America and the USA Today/ESPN coaches' poll.

cs431:rssItem.title: UM baseball team ranked No. 1 in nation (Miami Herald)
cs431:rssItem.description: The University of Miami baseball team is No. 1 in the nation. Of 296 Division I baseball teams across the country, the Hurricanes, with a 26-2 overall record and 12-1 record in the Atlantic Coast Conference, are the best according to Baseball America.

cs431:rssItem.title: Teens rampage through Australian school with baseball bats, machetes; 19 hurt (The Canadian Press via Yahoo! Canada News)
cs431:rssItem.description: SYDNEY, Australia - Five teenagers brandishing baseball bats and machetes rampaged through a suburban school Monday and hit a teacher over the head who tried to stop them, police said. Eighteen students were treated for minor injuries.

cs431:rssItem.title: Slide show: Douglas baseball and softball (The Record-Courier)
cs431:rssItem.description: The Damonte Ranch baseball team came to Tiger Field Thursday afternoon riding a 14-game win streak.

cs431:rssItem.title: USC drops from top 10 in pair of baseball polls (The Greenville News)
cs431:rssItem.description: The University of South Carolina dropped out of the top 10 in a pair of baseball polls today after being swept in a weekend series by the University of Georgia.

cs431:rssItem.title: Riverside baseball ranked No. 2 in state (The Greenville News)
cs431:rssItem.description: The Riverside High baseball team is ranked No. 2 in the state in Class AAA in the South Carolina Baseball Coaches Association poll.

cs431:rssItem.title: Teens Rampage School With Baseball Bats, Machetes (KTRE-TV East Texas)
cs431:rssItem.description: Eighteen students and a teacher at a school near Sydney, Australia, were treated for injuries today after being attacked by five teenagers armed with baseball bats and machetes.

cs431:rssItem.title: Sidney Baseball Commission going back to basics (Sidney Herald-Leader)
cs431:rssItem.description: Experience has taught Kirby Halvorson what it takes to field a successful baseball program. As a high schooler in Scobey, he played on five consecutive state legion championship teams.

cs431:rssItem.title: Monday's college roundup: NSU baseball game again postponed; CNU gains sportsmanship honor (Daily Press)
cs431:rssItem.description: Norfolk State's elusive efforts to play Maryland-Eastern Shore in baseball were delayed again because of rain.

cs431:nsdlItem.dc:description: This Web site, created to complement the Baseball as America exhibit, looks at how this sport has changed along with the country. It includes the following sections.Our National Spirit dxamines why the label "national pastime" has grown increasingly accurate over time. Ideals and Injustices considers the game's troubling legacy of segregation and why the sport is seen as "doorway to American culture" by many immigrants. Sharing a Common Culture looks at how the game and its heroes have become a form of cultural shorthand. Rooting for the Team examines the ways we share in the experience of the game, from trading cards to the seventh-inning stretch. Invention and Ingenuity—Looks at how the American spirit has helped shape the game. Enterprise and Opportunity considers the business of baseball, from the Players' Association to branded candy bars.Weaving Myths looks at the nostalgia of stadiums and how we live out our fantasies through players' achievements.
cs431:nsdlItem.dc:title: Baseball as America

cs431:nsdlItem.dc:description: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum offers 10 middle and high school educators ten interdisciplinary national standards based units. The detailed units cover a variety of topics related to baseball including women in baseball, influences of technology and society on uniforms, the business of baseball, geography of baseball park locations, technology of baseball, artist intrepretations of the game, and the math of baseball performance. In addition, two other lesson plans focus on the impact of such players as Lou Gehrig and Jackie Robinson. Each lesson is also offered in PDF format (requires Acrobat Reader).
cs431:nsdlItem.dc:rights: Metadata may be used without restrictions as long as the oai identifier remains attached to it.

cs431:nsdlItem.dc:description: The Library of Congress offers two special online presentations about baseball history. Baseball, the Color Line, and Jackie Robinson, 1860s-1960s "is a time line in five sections. It draws on approximately thirty itemsmanuscripts, books, photographs, and ephemerafrom many parts of the Library. The first three sections of the presentation describe the color line that segregated baseball for many years, the Negro Leagues, and Branch Rickey and Jackie Robinsontwo men who played key roles in integrating the sport. The last two sections of the presentation explore Robinson's career as a Dodger and his civil rights activities." Early Baseball Pictures, 1860s-1920s "features 34 intriguing photographs and prints arranged in the following categories: Baseball Beginnings, Game Day in the Majors, Players, Non-Major League Baseball, Major League Teams and Games." Baseball Highlights is a part of the American Memory project.
